sentence.Network_en: I tried to drag myself out of the morass of despair.
sentence.Network_cn: 我试图从绝望的困境中走出来。

sentence.Network_en: Mathematical knowledge was certain and offered a secure foothold in a morass.
sentence.Network_cn: 数学知识是确定无疑的,它给人们在沼泽地上提供了一个稳妥的立足点.

sentence.Network_en: EXAMPLE : During the rainy season the valley became an impassible morass.
sentence.Network_cn: 雨季的山谷变成了不可通行的沼泽.

list.abs: Mona Monroe mourned the moral morass of the monster ., 门罗夫人为这个陷入道德困境的怪物而哀伤.

indeed , Mr Singh is adamant that whoever forms the next government , India will continue on its path away from the economic morass of the 1970s and 1980s .实际上，辛格坚定地认为，无论由谁来组建下一任政府，印度都将坚持改革道路，远离上世纪七八十年代的经济泥沼。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: from Dutch moeras, alteration (by assimilation to moer 'moor') of Middle Dutch marasch, from Old French marais 'marsh', from medieval Latin mariscus

entry.tran: 复杂混乱的情况;乱糟糟的一堆;困境
entry.def: If you describe an unpleasant or confused situation as a morass, you mean that it seems impossible to escape from or resolve, because it has become so serious or so complicated.

example.ex: I tried to drag myself out of the morass of despair.
example.tran: 我试图从绝望的困境中走出来。

means.word_mean: 1. a soft wet area of low-lying land that sinks underfoot
